subject: Re: [junit] Private method throws an exception
msgSnippet: ... That s very interesting because if that method were protected instead of private, the problem wouldn t exist :-) -- Cédric http://testng.org [Non-text
messageBody:
On 10/31/05, Mitch Christensen <mitchellch@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks for the feedback.
>
> My private method fails (during test execution) because it interacts with
> Torque (OR mapping tool) to talk to the database. Because this method is
> private, I can't override it in a base class, and I'm a bit at a loss for
> how to avoid its Torque interaction. I'm feeling that there must be an
> injection technique that I can use to get a mock object into that method to
> circumvent the Torque interaction.
>
> FWIW, I agree with Elliotte about making the private method
> public/protected.


That's very interesting because if that method were protected instead of
private, the problem wouldn't exist :-)

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
